identification.cap: Conical to bell-shaped, 0.3-1.2 inches, hygrophanous: moist reddish-brown to chocolate brown (greenish-blue tinge), dry light yellow-brown to olivaceous-brown, papilla present.
identification.gills: Narrow, moderately crowded, cream when young, darkening to purple-brown with lighter edge, adnexed to sinuate.
identification.stem: Slender, tapering, 1-2 inches long, 0.04-0.08 inches thick, reddish-brown, paler at top, floccose whitish fibrils below, long whitish pseudorhiza up to 5.9 inches, possible dark annular zone.
identification.blue_staining: All parts stain blue when bruised, hard to see due to pigmentation, indicates psilocybin.
identification.microscopic: Spores subellipsoid/rhomboid 5-6 × 6.5-8.5 μm; basidia 14-25 × 4.5-7.5 μm; cheilocystidia type A lageniform 15-27 × 5-7 μm, type B utriform 25-32 × 6-9 μm.

habitat: Moist, rich soils in mountain cloud forests of Veracruz, Mexico and Costa Rica reserves.
conservation: Endangered, limited to 10 localities, habitat degradation, 68% reduction predicted in Mexico.
